title: U.S. business inventories increase in January
content:
HOUSTON, March 16 (Xinhua) -- U.S. business inventories for January increased, according to the latest U.S. manufacturing and trade statistics report released on Tuesday.
Manufacturers' and trade inventories, adjusted for seasonal variations but not for price changes, were estimated at an end-of-month level of 1,982.4 billion U.S. dollars, up 0.3 percent from December 2020, but were down 1.8 percent from January 2020, said the report of the U.S. Department of Commerce.
The combined value of distributive trade sales and manufacturers' shipments for January, adjusted for seasonal and trading day differences but not for price changes, was estimated at 1,568.5 billion dollars, up 4.7 percent from December 2020 and was up 7.1 percent from January 2020.
The total business inventories/sales ratio based on seasonally adjusted data at the end of January was 1.26. The January 2020 ratio was 1.38. Enditem
